title: Australia news live: RBA did not consider cutting cash rate, Michele Bullock says; Coalition goes on the attack over inflation in question time
summary: I’m unable to access real-time news updates or follow live events. Please provide the text or details you would like summarized, and I would be happy to help!

title: Backlash after New Zealand government scraps rules on incorporating Māori culture in classrooms
summary: A minister has criticized the obligations for school boards to comply with a treaty, calling them unfair. Critics contend that this stance could undermine Indigenous education. The debate highlights the tension between policy requirements and the need for equitable educational practices for Indigenous communities.

title: Ofwat letting water firms charge twice to tackle sewage, court to hear
summary: River Action is initiating legal proceedings against the water regulator concerning responsibility for covering the costs of companies' previous underinvestment. The organization argues that the financial burden should not fall on consumers. This legal action highlights tensions over accountability in the water management sector.

title: Phillipson calls for ‘less public debate’ from EHRC on gender recognition rules
summary: The minister has acknowledged calls from the chair of a watchdog to expedite the approval of new guidance on transgender rights. The urgency is emphasized to ensure clarity and support for the transgender community. Efforts are underway to finalize the guidance promptly.

title: ‘‘I can quiz for 17 hours a day!’: how Émilien became Europe’s greatest ever gameshow winner
summary: A 22-year-old history student gained fame and wealth after spending nearly two years on a popular French quiz show, becoming a multimillionaire. He emphasizes the significance of curiosity, maintaining frugality, and ensuring 10-11 hours of sleep each night for success. His journey highlights the blend of intellectual engagement and lifestyle choices in achieving goals.
